title: 【遍地開花】一群醫務化驗師之聯署公開信

replies.msg:
「知事，而不鳴，為大惡。」

一眾醫務化驗師擇善固執，決定聯署發聲，希望其他化驗師以及廣大市民，也可一同表態。

特區政府怠政，警方濫權施暴，我等嚴正呼籲政府承擔責任，收拾送中殘局。

致特首林鄭月娥女士、特區政府官員及香港市民：

我們是一群居於香港、熱愛香港、服務香港的醫務化驗師。過往一直盡忠職守，遵從國際標準，運用精確的科學方法及原理，協助找出病因。目的是讓醫生對症下藥，令病者得到最穩妥、合適及具科學基礎的治療。公共行政有如醫學病理，從政者理應以理性開放態度，審視社會現況，廣納百川，細聽諫言，從而在獲得民意授權的基礎下作有效施政，對症下藥，惜當今政府卻無此擔當。

近月，香港特區政府硬推《逃犯條例》修訂，漠視社會各階層對此的意見和訴求。面對愈發強烈的反對聲音，更是態度傲慢、一意孤行。政府不但試圖以差劣的公關手段敷衍香港市民，更拒絕正面回應撤例訴求，甚至對於反對聲音肆意抹黑，以致民怨四起，實為社會撕裂之根本。
特區政府自推行《逃犯條例》修訂以來，一直未有誠懇接納市民意見、妥善回應市民訴求，反而縱容警察施暴，釀成多次流血事件。就7月21日發生之元朗暴徒無差別襲擊市民一役而言，對比過往反修例示威行動，政府及警方處理手法存極大差異，為世詬病。以往就反修例運動作暴動定性及搜捕示威者，有關部門自詡處事果決及高效率。唯警方就疑似黑社會襲擊市民，則以怠慢甚或放任態度處理，無視區議員早前的反映，違背對其安排調配人手之承諾。此舉確有勾結暴徒、縱容暴行之嫌，乃致信譽破產。警察身為維持治安的公僕，罔顧市民安危，實難辭其咎。

對於官警鄉黑勾結的指控，有關部門至今仍未能作出合理解釋，僅以官腔說法愚弄廣大市民。作為一個代表香港市民、為香港服務的政治班子，竟對警方一次又一次濫權施暴予以默許，甚至支持，這正是現今社會嚴重撕裂之詬因。

事態發展至今僅月餘，香港病情卻已急速惡化，危在旦夕。鑒於政府之怠政無能，以及警方違反專業操守乃至失職，我等予以強烈譴責；同時促請特區政府落實針對性措施回應社會五大訴求：
一、 全面撤回《逃犯條例》修訂
二、 收回暴動定性
三、 撤銷所有對抗爭者之檢控
四、 成立獨立調查委員會徹查警察濫權及懷疑警黑勾結
五、 立即實行雙真普選

我們會一直謹守專業崗位，盼望香港早日痊癒，重新出發。

一群註冊醫務化驗師謹啟

In respect of administrative indolence of the HKSAR government and abuse of power by the HK Police Force, we earnestly urge the involved parties to shoulder their responsibilities in this time of chaos.

Dear Chief Executive Mrs. Carrie Lam, her cabinet and fellow Hongkongers,

We are a group of Medical Laboratory Technologists, who inhabits, loves and serves Hong Kong. We have been working diligently and dutifully to aid medical diagnosis, using accurate, precise and internationally recognized scientific methods. This is all in an effort to assist physicians in devising the most suitable and efficacious treatment plan on a scientifically sound basis. Public administration and governance is akin to medical practice. Government officials should be rational, sensible and open-minded. Carefully analyzing social reality and embracing constructive criticisms and advice allow the government to serve the public with efficacy and support. Regrettably, officials currently in power fail miserably.

In recent months, the extradition bill has caused an uproar in our society. Our government’s blatant disregard for the overwhelming public outrage and well-intentioned advice from diverse groups and entities was beyond reason. Faced with ever-growing public discontent, our government turned their nose up and continued furthering their agenda without batting an eye. Instead of responding head-on to our appeal for full withdrawal of the bill, they pulled tricks after tricks, hoping to fool us into retreat, trying to turn us against one another. All the while they waged smear campaigns against peaceful protesters, adding fuel to the fire.

Not only has our cry for justice been ignored, our government’s implicit approval of police brutality has caused numerous bloodsheds, each more disastrous and disheartening than the last. Such police brutality, left untreated, has festered into domestic terrorism, as evident in the mob attack in Yuen Long on July 21. In contrast to recent protests, this mob attack was not handled with such efficiency and speed that the Police Force proudly claim to have held. Police officers stood by while the mob violently attacked and terrorized citizens indiscriminately. There is evidence that district council members had warned the Police Force of such planned attacks well in advance, and were promised follow-up actions. The unfulfilled promises have raised suspicions of collusion between the Police Force and local gang members. In face of accusations of collusions amongst the Police, mobsters, local villager power and the government, involved government officials have yet to provide solid explanations. Regardless, neglecting the safety of those they serve, the Police Force must assume all responsibility. Such continued abuse of power, violence and dereliction of duties by our public servants are setting Hong Kong ablaze.

In less than two months’ time, Hong Kong has deteriorated at an unfathomable rate, reaching the brink of death. We strongly condemn the impotence and negligence of the HKSAR government and the HK Police Force. We urged our government to explore and implement targeted measures and policies in response to the public’s five demands:

1. Complete withdrawal of the extradition bill
2. Retraction of the rioting label for the June 12 clash
3. Dropping all criminal charges against participants in the Anti-Extradition Law Movement
4. Setting up an independent commission of inquiry to investigate the HK Police Force’s abuse of power and force
5. Universal suffrage for both Legislative Council and Chief Executive elections


Together we hope for a speedy recovery for Hong Kong. Meanwhile, we shall stand tall in our positions, as we always have. Stand with us; stand with Hong Kong.

Yours solemnly,
A group of registered Medical Laboratory Technologists
